newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian stocks dip, foreign funds stay away.
newsitem.headline: Colombian stocks dip, foreign funds stay away.

text.p: Colombian stocks dipped slightly in trading dominated by pocket-to-pocket deals and the absence of foreign funds.
Bogota's IBB IBB index fell a wafer-thin 0.03 percent to 1,167.72 amid a low 784 million peso volume in Bogota while Medellin's IBOMED fell 0.11 percent to 17,639.90 amid a 7.2 billion peso volume.
"There was not much to talk about in today's trading. There was a lot of apathy because of the absence of foreign funds," one Bogota dealer said.
On the Medellin exchange there was a cross-deal worth a total 1.5 billion pesos in the little-favored Imusa and Alumina shares. Both closed at 8,000.
One of the biggest climbers of the day was brewing giant Bavaria, up 2.07 percent to 8,050 in Bogota and up 0.38 percent to 8,030 in Medellin.
The fall on the Bogota and Medellin exchanges was caused largely by a dip in supermarket chain Cadenalco and cigarette manufacturer Coltabaco.
Cadenalco fell 1.14 percent to 860 pesos in Bogota and 1.15 percent to the same price in Medellin. Coltabaco dived 4.13 percent to 3,500 in Bogota 4.11 percent to the same price in Medellin.
